data.text: @CambridgeUgly @UnnecessaryOCD Fantastic idea. Thank you. The last film I saw was Parasite. Extraordinary. Only two of us watching it.
@DrWMB @UnnecessaryOCD You can see how many seats are bought and where people are sitting when you buy your ticket. If it's too sold out- don't go. It has definitely made me feel a bit more normal.
@CambridgeUgly @UnnecessaryOCD That’s a great tip, I haven’t dared do the cinema yet but would love to go.
@DrWMB @UnnecessaryOCD Cinema is good when the film is about to finish it's run as it's pretty empty. Watched Belfast last week with only 5 others in the whole screening

@CambridgeUgly @UnnecessaryOCD I won’t be in a hurry to sit inside a pub again. Too unpredictable. Too many low ceilings and alcoves for the virus to lurk in the air. People tend to linger around the bar. But I’m glad I’ve worked this out. I’m working out where I can go if I’m feeling reckless & desperate.
@JennieTodd20 @UnnecessaryOCD I’m thinking if it was busier and not nice for sitting outside, I could get a seat as near to the door as possible for frequent ventilation.
@DrWMB @UnnecessaryOCD I haven't been to a pub since Feb 2020. Still braving the outside in cafes and restaurants
